programme.title: It'll Be Alright on the Night
programme.desc: David Walliams returns with more TV disasters featuring the world's most famous faces. Joanna Lumley nearly falls off a ship, the Good Morning Britain Studio is invaded by ants, and Katy Perry is interrupted by a fire alarm. Plus, there are TV nightmares for the cast and crew of Love Island, Coronation Street, Catchphrase, and I'm A Celebrity.

programme.title: Strictly the Real Full Monty
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ashley Banjo and his team of celebrities try to put cancer awareness back in the spotlight by pulling off an all-singing, all-dancing spectacular in the world's biggest ballroom in Blackpool. But after months of training, tantrums and tears, will all the handwork pay off or has Ashley finally bitten off more then he can chew? The cast grows in numbers with celebrity additions including Coleen Nolen and Ola Jordan, but the scale of the performance soon has the group doubting themselves as the dress rehearsal proves to be a disaster, and two of the cast must sit out injured. Will the big night turn out to be a Strictly success?.

The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Morecambe & Wise: The Lost Tapes
programme.desc: A series of sketches taken from the recently-unearthed Morecambe & Wise tape that contained footage which had not been seen for 50 years, and was believed to have been lost forever. The newly discovered half-hour show featured a series of gag-packed routines involving stage curtains, ventriloquism and a daring sketch in which Eric eavesdrops on a newly wedded couple in the flat next door. Now, contributors including Jonathan Ross, Ben Miller and Eddie Izzard look back at this rare slice of classic comedy once again.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport

programme.title: Great British Landmark Fixers
programme.desc: Salt water and iron don't mix and Southend Pier, built back in 1888, has seen better days. Now a team of specialists are working hard to prevent it falling into the sea.

programme.title: Hornby: A Model World
programme.desc: The Scalextric team attempt to tap into the brand's glory years, the 1980s, and devise a plan to create a model of a classic supercar, the Lamborghini Countach.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The largest and most sophisticated radio telescope on the planet, which draws inspiration from geodesic dome designs and the work of 18th-century engineer Jean Marie Jacquard.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of London's Crossrail network, a project of staggering proportions, with 10,000 personnel working across 40 sites and on 118km of track. The focus should have been on the impressive engineering feat, though delays and budgets have become the focus of attention.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Qinghai-Tibet line, the highest railway in the world, providing an insight into the engineering challenges faced at high altitude and in bitterly cold temperatures.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How a team of intrepid engineers keep the London Array, one of the largest offshore wind farms on the planet, maintained and producing electricity whatever the weather.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his early 20th century Bradshaw's Guide, Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a trip through Britain's industrial heartlands in the footsteps of George V, beginning by travelling from Warrington to Preston.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Blackburn, Michael Portillo catches a rare glimpse of Edwardian life on celluloid and marvels at how factory workers and schoolchildren alike were drawn to seek fame on film. Continuing east to Nelson, Michael braves the enemy camp to have a pint of tea with the socialist working classes in Britain's last Clarion House.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Heaton Park in Manchester, where one of the first open air concerts was held in 1909, before travelling on to the town of Oldham. Michael then ventures to Edale in the Peak District, where he joins ramblers in walking country, and learns how a Sheffield socialist spearheaded a mass trespassing revolt to open up the countryside to working people.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Maltby to Hinckley, going whippet racing and trying to understand the appeal of Marmite, before a look around the Triumph motorcycle factory.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his Bradshaw's guide, Michael Portillo reaches Birmingham and discovers how a radical reformer made his mark on the 'city of a thousand trades'. At Highbury Hall, he finds Joseph Chamberlain's mansion home and hears how he established a political dynasty including a prime minister and a foreign secretary. Next stop is Cradley Heath, once one of five chain-making towns in the West Midlands. At the centre of Britain's ceramic industry in Stoke-on-Trent, Michael visits Wedgwood, established by 'Queen's Potter' Josiah Wedgwood in 1759 and visited in 1913 by King George V and Queen Mary.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a journey across Northern Ireland to Argyll and Bute, beginning by travelling from Newry to Portadown.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a special episode from the Houses of Parliament celebrating the 100th anniversary of women winning the right to vote, examining artefacts connected to remarkable women throughout British history, including leading suffragist Millicent Fawcett, photographer Christina Broom, secret agent Violette Szabo, gymnast Florence Atwood and polar explorers Ann Daniels and Caroline Hamilton.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Tower of London
programme.desc: An exploration of British landmarks, beginning with a look at the Tower of London - which has served as a castle, a jail and a place of execution.

programme.title: Great British Landmark Fixers

programme.desc: Gok shares his best recipes for a fabulous Christmas Day feast. Dishes include indulgent French toast with an Asian twist, and belly pork with honey and soy sauce.

programme.title: Jamie's Night Before Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver returns to help the viewers raise their seasonal game with foolproof recipes and clever last-minute ways to improve their festive dishes. Having surveyed thousands of Brits to find out what ingredients they have bought, what is on their menus and what they already have in their cupboards, Jamie looks at what people fear most about cooking on Christmas Day - from getting the timings right to soggy roast potatoes or a dry turkey - and presents tips to make Christmas dinner classics taste better than ever.

programme.title: Mary Berry's Country House at Christmas
programme.desc: Mary Berry visits Harewood House in West Yorkshire as staff prepare the house for the Christmas festivities, and discovers how country houses like this celebrate the season on a grand scale. She also meets some of the volunteers that are the life and soul of the country house, and hears their stories as they bake traditional gingerbread together. Later, she heads out into Harewood's spectacular grounds and gathers winter foliage for her own seasonal decorations before attending a glittering party for the staff and volunteers, who gather together to preview the house's astounding decorations.

programme.title: Girl Meets Farm
programme.desc: Molly prepares a festive buffet and edible gifts for three generations of her family, with dishes including pastrami meatballs, brussels sprouts latkes and marzipan treats.

programme.title: Girl Meets Farm
programme.desc: Molly and Nick are celebrating Christmas Eve with Chinese food. Molly's festive menu includes juicy pork soup dumplings and kung pao chicken.

programme.title: The Hairy Bakers
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King travel around the nation cooking their favourite festive treats as they plan an early celebration for firefighters, nurses, police and ambulance crews who will be spending yuletide away from their families. The food lovers rustle up classic Christmas pudding, mince pies and chestnut soup, before ending their journey with a feast at the world's largest tree house.

programme.title: James Martin's Christmas With Friends
programme.desc: James Martin invites his celebrity friends around for Christmas cooking, as he shares some of his favourite festive recipes.

programme.title: Jamie's Ultimate Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver has been cooking and experimenting with classic Christmas food for over two decades and this programme pulls together his knowledge and experience to bring the very best of the season. He begins with what he calls the three foundations of Christmas, with guests will forgiving any mistakes as long as the turkey is succulent, the gravy is tasty, and the roast potatoes are perfect, and serves the main course with Brussels sprouts done with chorizo and chestnuts, and glazed carrots. Jamie also shares some other dishes, including gravadlax steeped in a beetroot, horseradish and vodka marinade, as well as gooey chocolate pots, turkey risotto, cocktails, and a classic beef Wellington.

In a separate case, two drug addicts accused of killing a boy for his mobile phone are found not guilty of murder.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Charity Wakefield and Hattie Morahan lead the cast in Andrew Davies's adaptation of Jane Austen's classic novel about a voyage of sexual and romantic discovery. Following the death of her husband, Mrs Dashwood and her daughters are forced to give up their home and move to a small cottage in Devonshire. Elinor is disappointed to leave her old home after falling in love with Edward Ferrars, her sister-in-law's brother, but looks forward to a promised visit. Marianne quickly finds she has an admirer in Colonel Brandon but is swept of her feet by neighbour Willoughby.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Colonel Brandon is called away on urgent business, leaving Marianne free to fall blissfully in love with Willoughby - until he too suddenly leaves for London. Meanwhile, Elinor has a disappointing meeting with Edward, but the reasons for his distant behaviour become clear when Sir John's niece Lucy Steele entrusts her with a shocking secret.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Marianne's health deteriorates as Colonel Brandon reveals the full extent of Willoughby's betrayal. Meanwhile, Edward states his intentions to honour his engagement to Lucy Steele, despite being disinherited by his mother as a result. Charity Wakefield and Dominic Cooper star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: Raf feels isolated from Amy while also having to work alongside Harry, until a vulnerable patient makes him realise he can't live without his wife. Guy offers Jesse a permanent contract but he is reluctant to accept it, knowing that he won't be quite so popular once the CEO finds out about his relationship with Zosia - and as she grows more obsessive, it becomes increasingly difficult to keep a lid on things. Jonny decides to move back to Scotland with Emma - can Mo convince her best friend to stay at Holby?.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: An old friend of Lenny's tries to embroil him in a plot to burn down the children's home where they spent their youth. Adam is terrified of Jessica regaining consciousness because he will have to tell her the truth about Harry, Jordan is reappointed as acting clinical lead following the recent traumatic events, Louis returns demanding money from Charlie, and Polly faces the inquiry into Alistair's death. Guest starring Barry Sloane (Hollyoaks).

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Quinnan and Boulton tackle the strange case of a drugged dog and a shady hippy, while Hollis defends the reputation of Sun Hill in a pub quiz. Police drama, starring Andrew Paul, Russell Boulter and Jeff Stewart.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Jamie and Martin are in trouble over goods stolen by Martin. Peggy looks at herself in the mirror and breaks down. Jeff and Rosa argue over Nicky. Roy answers an impotence advert.

programme.desc: Peggy and Pat shop for Peggy's wedding dress. Ricky will be Frank's Best Man. Pat warns Barry about Natalie. Alex warns Melanie about Ian. Roy goes in search of Viagra.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar readies itself for Christmas 1960 with a festive bus trip to see the Regent Street lights, while a visit from a BBC film crew promises to make it a festive holiday to remember. However, it's a difficult time for grieving mother Iris, bringing back memories of her long-departed baby daughter. At Nonnatus, things are tense as Sister Monica Joan determines to bring the Christmas spirit early - despite Sister Evangelina's disgust. As the community prepares for a televised carol concert, it becomes apparent that Sister Monica Joan has gone missing. Jenny Agutter and Judy Parfitt star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Easter approaches in the spring of 1961, and Patsy helps to deliver a baby that is born with severe deformities. Her husband struggles to cope with his daughter's needs, but the sisters rally round to support the family. Trixie teaches a keep fit class which results in a medical emergency, leaving her determined to teach her patients to understand their own bodies.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara treats a pregnant woman whose dockworker husband is struggling to support her as opportunities for work dry up. She is forced into a difficult decision that leaves Barbara facing the biggest test of her career. Nurse Crane meets a kindred spirit when she learns to speak Spanish, and Sister Evangelina helps a woman with breastfeeding, leading to unforeseen consequences.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A rare disease spreads around Poplar Street, and Patsy and Dr Turner try to trace the outbreak to its source. Suspicion over the identity of the first carrier threatens to divide a previously close-knit family. Sister Winifred is forced to confront her prejudices while treating a patient, and Barbara worries about how Trixie will react when she agrees to go to dinner with Tom.

programme.desc: Foggy persuades Clegg and Compo that starting a dog-walking business will be no work at all since they are already going on daily countryside rambles. However, the experience proves to be more of a workout than the trio envisage. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

Slowly, however, Jonathan traces the sequence of events and begins to suspect one of the apparent deaths was staged. Crime drama, with Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin, guest starring Amanda Holden.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the killing of a zookeeper, thought to have been mauled to death by a tiger in 2006, when blood found in the victim's lodgings suggests he was murdered before his body was placed in the big-cat enclosure. However, not all the team members are happy about the new case as Brian's animal rights tendencies come to the fore, bringing him into conflict with the zoo's PR. Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman star.

Darlene falls under the spell of the star prisoner but Costa cons Phyl and Bev fall out over her, while new wing governor Bodybag Hollamby's efforts to make her mark on the place pale into insignificance. Fern Britton and Phillip Schofield guest star as themselves.

programme.title: Call the Midwife

programme.sub-title: The Fast and the Ridiculous - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The guys finally find a not so perfect car for the Arizona Lemons race, and resurrect into 'The Count's Bloody Mess'.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers assess the value of a pair of boots signed by champion jockey Bill Shoemaker and General Patton's autograph.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team comes across a famous Picasso etching, a rare REO Flying Cloud hot rod and a man trying to sell two gold-plated pairs of miniature trousers.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: In a First World War special, Suggs and Stephen Taylor excavate the site of a huge transit camp at Morn Hill, outside Winchester, home to over two million troops, travelling from all over the Empire to the Western Front. They find an array of artefacts from 100 years ago, including dog-tags from British and American soldiers - one of whom they track all the way to his living relative. Also unearthed are iron heels from hobnail boots, cap badges and steel fixings for epaulettes from the 23rd London Regiment, bayonets from Lee Enfield 303s and many more intriguing artefacts such as a condom tin.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Stephen Taylor and Suggs head to Lincolnshire to dig up the remains of a Boulton Paul Defiant plane, one of the best British interceptor night-time fighter planes, shot down by the Luftwaffe during the Hull Blitz of March 1941.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: In Weedon Bec, Northamptonshire, Suggs and Stephen Taylor unearth a wealth of Second World War relics from a hoard of ammunition cans to parts of Sten and Bren guns as they uncover the very secret past of a huge, top-secret, arms supply depot that, unknown to many, played a pivotal role in winning the war.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor head on the trail of an iconic Mark IX Spitfire in Belgium. Joining Belgium's top plane hunters, Stephen sets about uncovering the remains of the Spitfire that was shot down while accompanying RAF bombers attacking Nazi trains just before D Day in 1944. Meanwhile, Suggs sets out to find out more about the fate of the Czech pilot Arnost Mrtvy, and discovers how the Czech pilots joined the RAF and provided a fierce and skilled fighting force against the Nazis.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Suggs and Stephen Taylor investigate the remains of an RAF Fairey Battle bomber plane shot down during the forgotten days after Dunkirk as the remaining British and French forces fought to prevent the Nazis sweeping through France. Stephen and his team look for remaining parts of the plane, while Suggs uncovers what they were doing in France and his detective work in France and Britain leads the pair to uncover the Fairey Battle's fate - at the hands of a French plane piloted by Polish pilots who tragically mistook the British for Germans.

programme.title: Hitler's Secret Tunnels
programme.desc: Seventy years after the end of the Second World War, hundreds of miles of tunnels built by the Nazis may still be protecting Hitler's final secrets. When explorers Mike Scott and Luke Mahoney uncover a hidden Nazi document that reveals a sealed Nazi underworld, they search these unexplored tunnel complexes that might hold the answers.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: Documentary following the quest by a dedicated group of investigators to solve one of the last great mysteries of the Second World War. In 1945, as Allied forces closed in, Japanese troops commanded by the notorious Japanese General Yamashita allegedly buried a fortune in treasure in the Philippines. They start their search on a remote mountain, followingacting on a tip from a local eyewitness.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: The team must find another way into the mountain when a potential water trap is unearthed while digging at Breach-6. A scan reveals a mysterious cave.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: The unearthing of a bomb-maker leads the team to some intriguing discoveries - and the first hint of treasure - as they draft in an explosives expert to help.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: A possible water trap triggered by the team members forces them to stop digging. A Navy diver is drafted in to explore the plunge pools and find an entrance.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: The team members get a breakthrough when they search for a tunnel at the waterfall. They uncover a symbol that could indicate a secret back-door entrance.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: The team members battle against a typhoon while trying to prove that the unique formation of rocks they have found could be a secret backdoor entrance into the mountain.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: The team focuses on a tunnel that could be part of the treasure labyrinth. A lawyer reveals some interesting information about Yamashita's treasure.

programme.title: Lost Gold of World War II
programme.desc: Peter is warned of the deadly risks that come with searching for Yamashita's treasure. After days of frustration, the team get their biggest breakthrough yet.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island: Drilling Down
programme.desc: Matty Blake sits down with Oak Island legend Dave Blankenship and takes a deep dive into Dave's history on the island, while trying to understand why he stepped away from the two centuries old treasure hunt that he and his father devoted their lives to.

programme.title: Colditz - The Legend
programme.desc: The story of Germany's Colditz Castle prisoner-of-war camp that housed Allied prisoners thought to be highly dangerous. The tales of daring Allied escape efforts and MI9 rescue missions are told by the surviving soldiers and the families of those who achieved the impossible - they managed to escape it.

programme.desc: Cases in which partners teamed up to commit murder, including execution-style killings by two taxi drivers in New Jersey. Plus, an insight into a new DNA identification technique.

programme.desc: An investigation into the disappearance of a woman in Key West, Florida, that yielded nothing but a pair of sandals which may have belonged to her. Then two important pieces of video surfaced, and police began to wonder if they should be searching for a missing person or a killer.

programme.desc: The case of a mother-of-two and army wife found dead in her bedroom. There were messages left near her body, and a gun in her hand.
